qas.question: What group was responsible for the April 25, 1988 protest?
What did the marchers wish to commemorate?
Which group held secret Milleneum of Christianity celebrations?
In what city did the Ukrainian Cultural Club have its Millennium celebration?

context: On April 26, 1988, about 500 people participated in a march organized by the <a0_0>Ukrainian Cultural Club<a0_0/> on <a1_0>Kiev's Khreschatyk Street<a1_0/> to mark the second anniversary of the <a2_0>Chernobyl nuclear disaster,<a2_0/> carrying placards with slogans like "Openness and Democracy to the End." Between May and June 1988, <a3_0>Ukrainian Catholics<a3_0/> in western Ukraine celebrated the Millennium of Christianity in Kievan Rus' in secret by holding services in the forests of Buniv, Kalush, Hoshiv, and Zarvanytsia. On June 5, 1988, as the official celebrations of the Millennium were held in Moscow, the Ukrainian Cultural Club hosted its own observances in <a4_0>Kiev<a4_0/> at the monument to St. Volodymyr the Great, the grand prince of Kievan Rus'.
